Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Perioperative Chemotherapy with or without Bevacizumab in Gastric and Oesophagogastric Junctional Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicentre, open-label, randomised controlled trial recruited 1063 patients from 2007 to 2014.

Participants.evidence: patients with gastric and oesophagogastric junctional cancer

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive ECX with or without bevacizumab.

Objective.evidence: The primary objective was to assess overall survival.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was overall survival, measured from randomisation to death from any cause.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This multicentre, open-label, randomised controlled trial recruited 1063 patients from 2007 to 2014.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 1063 randomised patients, 895 underwent resection, with surgical details available for 880.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The trial demonstrated no significant difference in overall survival between the treatment arms.

Harms.evidence: Postoperative complications occurred in 458 patients (52.5%), with 71 (8.1%) experiencing life-threatening complications.
